summary: A character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail request. The author, who claims a lifelong relationship with the Maxwell family, describes Ghislaine's upbringing, character, work ethic, and argues she is not a flight risk and intends to defend herself at trial.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case, to whom this character reference letter is addressed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail request and character reference. The author describes her upbringing, education, personality, and argues she is not a flight risk.

persons.name: Bob Maxwell
persons.context: Referred to as the narcissistic, controlling, and demanding father of Ghislaine and her siblings, who informed them he would leave his fortune to charity.

persons.name: Mrs. Maxwell
persons.context: Ghislaine's mother, who the author supported after her husband's death and later read the author's book to on her deathbed in 2013.

connections.description: Father-daughter relationship. Described as demanding and critical, training his children to defend themselves with courage.
Mother-daughter relationship. The author notes Ghislaine and her siblings strove for their mother's respect.
The author claims a fairly close, lifelong relationship with the Maxwell family, knowing Ghislaine since she was 15 and spending time with her.

events.title: Death of Mrs. Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's mother died after suffering from Parkinson's disease. The author's book was read to her on her deathbed.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell remains in US
events.description: The author asserts that despite government allegations, Ghislaine Maxwell made no attempt to leave the United States in 2019.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is a character reference letter submitted to the court in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's 2020 bail request.
The author describes Robert Maxwell as narcissistic, controlling, and informing his children they would not inherit his fortune.
The author asserts Ghislaine Maxwell is mature, honest, strong-willed, and "categorically not a flight risk," intending to face trial.
The author claims Ghislaine Maxwell made no attempt to flee the U.S. in 2019 despite the pending accusations.
The letter provides personal background on Ghislaine's upbringing, education at Oxford, and her family's emphasis on personal responsibility.
